snippet: The company is accused of fraudulently claiming millions of dollars in reimbursement for tutoring services that the government said it never delivered to underprivileged students.
abstract: Federal prosecutors file lawsuit against test-preparation company Princeton Review, accusing it of fraudulently claiming millions of dollars in reimbursement for tutoring services that government says were never delivered to hundreds of underprivileged New York City schoolchildren.
lead_paragraph: The company is accused of fraudulently claiming millions of dollars in reimbursement for tutoring services that the government said it never delivered to underprivileged students.

headline.seo: Princeton Review Accused of Fraud in Tutoring Program
headline.main: Princeton Review Accused of Fraud in Tutoring Services
headline.print_headline: Princeton Review Is Accused Of Fraud in Tutoring Services
